title: Augusta County: Tony Pastor to Annie Harris, May 4, 1861
summary: This letter, written soon after Pastor joined the main army, details the difficulties of a soldier's life even before the war began. He asks the ladies of his town to send him clothes, which in the postcript he says he received. Further, he mentions that he is doubtful that the conflict can end peacefully and says that he is ready to die for Virginia.
keywords: Camp Life, Enlistment, Medicine/Hospitals, Military Authority, Patriotism, American Civil War
